intro: Chaerophyllum villarsii var. alpestre, commonly known as alpine cow parsley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern in some areas.
